intro: Calampelis scaber, commonly known as the rough calampelis, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and compound leaves that are arranged in a distinctive, feathery pattern. Its small, yellowish-white flowers appear in umbels, typical of the family, and bloom in the summer months. Calampelis scaber is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
